com.github.mmichaelis.describeme.core

Interface RecursiveDescriber

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Describer, Predicate<Object>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractStreamDescriber, ArrayDescriber, EntryDescriber, IterableDescriber, IteratorDescriber, MapDescriber, StreamDescriber, ThrowableDescriber

    public interface RecursiveDescriber
extends Describer
    Extension to Describer which handles recursion.
    Since:
    1.0.0

    • Method Detail

      • describeTo

        @Contract(value="null, _, _ -> fail")
default void describeTo(@NotNull
                                                               Appendable appendable,
                                                               @Nullable
                                                               Object value,
                                                               int maxCount)

        Add the description of the object to the given appendable.

        On implementation it is recommended to use for example Objects.requireNonNull(Object) to validate the appendable and to use Describer.validatedValue(Object) to validate that the object really matches the requirements - just in case someone did not call Describer.test(Object) before.

        Default implementation with depth DescriberProperties.MAX_DEPTH which is configurable through system properties.

        If your value can be converted to a stream it is recommended to extend AbstractStreamDescriber which will take care of looping through the stream.

        Specified by:
        describeTo in interface Describer
        Parameters:
        appendable - appendable to add value's string representation to
        value - the value to describe
        maxCount - limits the elements to be added to the appendable; a negative value denotes unlimited - it is recommended to use DescriberProperties.UNLIMITED; the maxCount parameter does not promise any length of the appended String but should denote a limit the String representation for large objects; maxCount typically refers to list or array elements
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • describeTo

        @Contract(value="null, _, _, _ -> fail")
default void describeTo(@NotNull
                                                                  Appendable appendable,
                                                                  @Nullable
                                                                  Object value,
                                                                  int maxCount,
                                                                  int maxDepth)

        Add the description of the object to the given appendable.

        Default implementation using some pre-defined recursion consumer which respects the given depth.

        Parameters:
        appendable - appendable to add value's string representation to
        value - the value to describe
        maxCount - limits the elements to be added to the appendable; a negative value denotes unlimited - it is recommended to use DescriberProperties.UNLIMITED
        maxDepth - the maximum depth to possibly recurse into an object to describe it; a negative value denotes unlimited - it is recommended to use DescriberProperties.UNLIMITED
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if appendable is null
        DescriberIoException - if a failure occurs accessing the appendable
        DescriberNotApplicableException - if the value handed over to the Describer cannot be handled by this describer; you should have called Describer.test(Object) before
        Since:
        1.0.0
        See Also:
        getRecursiveMeAndOtherConsumer(Appendable, int, int)

      • describeTo

        @Contract(value="null, _, _, _ -> fail; _, _, _, null -> fail")
void describeTo(@NotNull
                                                                                 Appendable appendable,
                                                                                 @Nullable
                                                                                 Object value,
                                                                                 int maxCount,
                                                                                 @NotNull
                                                                                 BiConsumer<Object,Object> recursiveMeAndOtherConsumer)

        Add the description of the object to the given appendable and recurse into sub elements of value using the recursiveMeAndOtherConsumer.

        Parameters:
        appendable - appendable to add value's string representation to
        value - the value to describe
        maxCount - limits the elements to be added to the appendable; a negative value denotes unlimited - it is recommended to use DescriberProperties.UNLIMITED
        recursiveMeAndOtherConsumer - consumer for recursion; call it with current value and sub element as second argument such that the consumer can detect self-contained object hierarchies
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if appendable and/or recursiveMeAndOtherConsumer is null
        DescriberIoException - if a failure occurs accessing the appendable
        DescriberNotApplicableException - if the value handed over to the Describer cannot be handled by this describer; you should have called Describer.test(Object) before
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • getRecursiveMeAndOtherConsumer

        @NotNull
default BiConsumer<Object,Object> getRecursiveMeAndOtherConsumer(@NotNull
                                                                           Appendable appendable,
                                                                           int maxDepth,
                                                                           int maxCount)

        Provides a recursive consumer. The first argument to the consumer will be the current described value, the second one the value to add to the description. These two values allow to detect self-contained structures and handle them.

        By default provides a recursive consumer respecting the given depth and detecting self-contained structures and replace them by a fixed String as given by DescriberProperties.RECURSION_PLACEHOLDER.

        Parameters:
        appendable - appendable to add the string representation to
        maxDepth - maximum depth
        maxCount - maximum element count
        Returns:
        consumer
